summary: This document is a chain of emails from January 2020 between U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) staff regarding travel arrangements for the Epstein investigation (2018R01618). The emails detail frustrations over booking refundable international flights to Stockholm, Sweden, for an interview, and reference prior travel for the investigation to locations like Los Angeles and West Palm Beach.

events.title: Planned Travel to Stockholm for Interview
events.description: Travel planned for the SDNY Epstein investigation team to conduct an interview near Stockholm, Sweden. The trip involves flights from JFK to Stockholm via Paris.

events.title: Travel to Los Angeles for Interview
events.description: Prior travel for the Epstein investigation team to conduct an interview (or interviews) in Los Angeles.

events.title: Travel to Los Angeles for Interview
events.description: Prior travel for an interview in Los Angeles related to the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Travel to West Palm Beach for Interview
events.description: Prior travel for an interview in West Palm Beach related to the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Travel to Los Angeles for Victim Interview
events.description: Prior travel to Los Angeles for a victim interview in the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Travel to West Palm Beach for Meetings/Interviews
events.description: Prior travel to West Palm Beach, Florida, for meetings and interviews with victims in the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Travel to West Palm Beach for Meetings/Interviews
events.description: Prior travel to West Palm Beach, Florida, for meetings and interviews related to United States v. Epstein.

events.title: Travel to West Palm Beach/Fort Lauderdale
events.description: Initial referenced travel for meetings and interviews in West Palm Beach and/or Fort Lauderdale, Florida, for the Epstein investigation.

keyFacts: The emails are from the U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) and relate to travel for the Epstein investigation, case number 2018R01618 (United States v. Epstein).
The primary purpose of the planned February 2020 travel was to conduct an interview near Stockholm, Sweden, indicating the international scope of the investigation.
The correspondence reveals internal friction and procedural issues within the SDNY regarding booking refundable international flights, which is a requirement for government travel.

The emails reference multiple prior trips for the same investigation to Los Angeles and West Palm Beach/Fort Lauderdale for victim interviews and meetings, showing an active investigation timeline from at least March 2019 to January 2020.
The document shows the investigation involved a team of prosecutors/investigators, though most names are redacted or referred to by initials.
